intro: Pouzolzia floresiana, commonly known as the Flores pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Flores in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal in horticultural settings.
